creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
I installed Tomcat 3.2 under Windows2000 with IIS, using out-of-process configuration.
I prepared primitive servlet  where doPost method only stored received  data to a new file. Also I prepared primitive sender – class. This class only reads file and sends it to the servlet. 
I can send file with size under 8K in a loop so many times, as I want.
With size under 80K I can send only one ore two times. 
Then client just hangs up.
With size more than 80K I can not send at all.
According documentation of tomcat I tried to use for JVM parameters –Xmx –Xms. I also tried to configure thread pool. It does not help much. 
To be sure that I do not have problems with my servlet and client, I have installed jrun and have done the same experiment with jrun. With jrun I can send file with size 1M and more in a loop without any problems. It looks like to me, that I did not tune something for Tomcat.
